intro: Plagiobothrys adpressus, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual herb with slender, often prostrate stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, blooming from spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Plagiobothrys adpressus is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and open fields.
